name: Your partner has disputed the application
body:
Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

Your ((partner)) has responded to your application and said they want to dispute the ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??ending of your civil partnership)). This means they want to try and prevent the ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??ending of your civil partnership)). 

You can read their response by signing into your ((isDivorce??divorce account))((isDissolution??account to end your civil partnership)): ((signin url)). 

#What happens next 
They have to submit an ‘answer’ to the court by ((date of response)). This is a form which explains their reasons for defending the ((isDivorce??divorce))((isDissolution??ending of your civil partnership)). 

If they submit the ‘answer’ then a judge will decide how to proceed. If they do not submit the form in time, then you will be able to proceed with the ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)).

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email.
subject: Your partner has disputed ((isDivorce??your divorce))((isDissolution??ending your civil partnership))
